name: Instruction Team Discussion Series: AI in information literacy instruction
desc:
- Burt and Casey
  \- “Fraught with Ought” sending misinformation
- ChaGTP promising results that it can’t generate
- [https://arcprize.org/](https://arcprize.org/ "smartCard-inline")
- pattern-making contextualization
- encoding > compressing > decoding
- changing the temperature of text prediction
- Look at current text sequence, predict the next token, add token to our current sequence
  - There’s no learning that is happening in the actual interaction
  - There’s no context with previous conversation - tabula rasa
- One perspective is that many of the models are just based on extensive web scraping – so if it hasn’t recorded something – or a near duplicate – it breaks down.
- Novel concepts and pattern-making ability breaks down these platforms
- The stumbling block is inference

[https://notebooklm.google/](https://notebooklm.google/ "smartCard-inline")

- Pedagogy: Demonstrate the shortcomings of inference
  - Moral psychology shortcomings
  - Wasting task theory

name: W10: Can You Try Again?: Using Large Language Models to Generate Alt Text for Online Image Collections
